text: W. H. "Hank" Norton (October 15, 1927 – January 16, 2019) was an American football coach. == Early life == He served as the head coach at Ferrum College in Ferrum, Virginia from 1960 to 1993. Norton coached Ferrum to four NJCAA National Football Championships and then guided the program to four-year NCAA varsity status in 1985. ==Head coaching record== ===College=== ==References== Category:1927 births Category: 2019 deaths Category:Ferrum Panthers football coaches Category:High school football coaches in Virginia Category:Junior college football coaches in the United States Category:University of Lynchburg alumni Category:Sportspeople from Huntington, West Virginia
title: Hank Norton
